info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 7:25AM EST until January 14 at 8:15AM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Butler County in west central Pennsylvania... Northwestern Indiana County in west central Pennsylvania... Northeastern Allegheny County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Southwestern Jefferson County in west central Pennsylvania... Northwestern Westmoreland County in southwestern Pennsylvania... Armstrong County in west central Pennsylvania... Southern Clarion County in west central Pennsylvania... * Until 815 AM EST. * At 725 AM EST, a hazardous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Rimersburg to near Hampton Township, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 30 and 50. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 70 and 77. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 64. Parkway North between mile markers 9 and 13. Locations impacted include... Ross Township, McCandless Township, Butler, Franklin Park, Punxsutawney, Vandergrift, Kittanning, Apollo, Rimersburg, Shaler Township, Plum, Hampton Township, New Kensington, Lower Burrell, Harrison Township, O'hara Township, Wexford, Homeacre-Lyndora, West View, and Oakmont. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
